channel.title: Fratricide Ach, What does it mean?
channel.description:
WARNING CONTAINS SPOILERS FROM PORTAL
The picture kinda explains it all. The first time I read it, I was like :'(:fffuuu::fffuuu: ![cube.jpg|330x500](upload://iuSnl73I1gUxKZtXurtfGGof1PO.jpeg)

item.title: Fratricide Ach, What does it mean?
item.dc:creator: Pettifogg
item.description:
Ballsopt:

wouldnt it be easier to just incinerate the body in the first place, and not go through all the trouble to load it into a cube.

It’s Aperture Science. It doesn’t have to make sense.

Read full topic
item.source: Fratricide Ach, What does it mean?

item.title: Fratricide Ach, What does it mean?
item.dc:creator: Ballsopt
item.description:
wouldnt it be easier to just incinerate the body in the first place, and not go through all the trouble to load it into a cube.
besides, anthropomorphizing an inanimate object is what some people do when they’re extremely lonely or steadily going crazy in the face of certain doom. Like Wilson the volleyball

Read full topic

item.source: Fratricide Ach, What does it mean?

item.title: Fratricide Ach, What does it mean?
item.dc:creator: Angdraug
item.description:
The theory might be sound, but the comic isn’t. Why would she conclude, that tossing a dead body into an incinerator would be murder? You can’t murder a dead body. It’s frigging dead already.

Sure they mention about the possibility of there being a badly wounded person in the cube, but if you’d mean that you shouldn’t say “carrying a dead body around the entire time”

Read full topic
item.source: Fratricide Ach, What does it mean?

item.title: Fratricide Ach, What does it mean?
item.dc:creator: JeffMOD
item.description:
Keep in mind, the achievement’s name wasn’t meant to be taken so literally.
It’s more because you’re supposed to become attached to the companion cube, as if it were a sibling.
(Sorry to ruin your theory )

Read full topic
